ranked_diseases.disease_name: Hypotonia, infantile, with psychomotor retardation and characteristic facies 3
ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with reference cases 1 and 3, sharing hypotonia, global developmental delay, and deeply set eyes. Age and presentation are consistent.
Classic features include short stature, brachycephaly, deeply set eyes, developmental delay, and hypotonia. The facial dysmorphism pattern fits well.
X-linked form with similar features to CdLS1 but typically milder. Compatible with the phenotype presented.
Features short stature, developmental delay, and characteristic facial features including deeply set eyes. Brachycephaly can be present.
Presents with developmental delay, short stature, hypotonia, and brachycephaly. Deeply set eyes are part of the facial phenotype.
Features severe developmental delay, hypotonia, and brachycephaly. Deeply set eyes are less typical but can occur.
Characterized by developmental delay, hypotonia, and distinctive facial features that can include deeply set eyes.
Features developmental delay, hypotonia, short stature, and coarse facial features. Deeply set eyes can be part of the phenotype.
